understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that returns the index summary capacity in MB.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration setting for the memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. The method 'getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB' is used to retrieve this configuration value.

config_description: A fixed memory pool size in MB for for SSTable index summaries. If left empty, this will default to 5% of the heap size. If the memory usage of all index summaries exceeds this limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries in order to meet this limit.  However, this is a best-effort process. In extreme conditions Cassandra may need to use more than this amount of memory.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' sets a fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. It is retrieved using DatabaseDescriptor.getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() and is used to initialize the memory pool size for the index summary manager.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered during the initialization of the IndexSummaryManager class. It is set when the class is instantiated and is not dynamically changed during runtime.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' configuration option is that it determines the maximum memory size allocated for SSTable index summaries. If the memory usage exceeds this limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries to meet this limit. However, in extreme conditions, Cassandra may need to use more memory than the specified limit.
